required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate the Continued Safety and Performance of the Foot and Ankle Products
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Prospective Registry to Evaluate the Continued Safety and Performance of the Foot and Ankle Products

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the registry is to evaluate the continued safety and performance of the Arthrex ProStop® implant used to treat hyperpronated foot.

detailed_description.textblock: To assess safety, related adverse events will be evaluated at six months postoperative and at one-year postoperative time points. To evaluate performance, physical exam and imaging of the target area of the body will be evaluated at three months postoperative. Additionally, patient reported outcomes will be evaluated at three months postoperative, six months postoperative and one year postoperative using the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS), Veterans Rand 12-Item Health Survey (VR-12) and Foot and Ankle Ability Measures (FAAM).

primary_outcome.measure: To assess change in Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) survey
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively, 3 months, 6 months and 12 months post operative
primary_outcome.description: Patient reported pain scale 0-10 point scale (0 min, 10 max)

primary_outcome.measure: To assess changes in Veterans RAND Health (VR-12) survey
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively, 3 months, 6 months and 12 months post operative
primary_outcome.description: Patient reported changes in general health and mental survey. Average score is 50 (negative answers bring scores down, positive answers bring score up)

primary_outcome.measure: To assess changes in Foot and Ankle Ability Measures (FAAM) survey
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively, 3 months, 6 months and 12 months post operative
primary_outcome.description: Patient reported change to physical function for individuals with foot and ankle related impairments. A higher score represents a higher level of physical function

arm_group.description: The ProStop® arthroereisis subtalar implant is intended to assist in treating the hyperpronated foot by stabilizing the subtalar joint. The main goal is to block forward, downward, medial displacement of the talus, and to help in reducing the talonavicular joint, thereby limiting excessive valgus of the hindfoot.

intervention.description: The ProStop® arthroereisis subtalar implant is intended to assist in treating the hyperpronated foot by stabilizing the subtalar join

study_pop.textblock: Approximately 50 subjects, male and female, age >2 to 17 years of age from the general population who are scheduled for surgery using the Arthrex ProStop® implant for treatment of hyperpronated foot. Subjects will be recruited from the surgeon's patient population.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject requires surgery for treatment of hyperpronated foot using the Arthrex ProStop® implant
2. Age >2 to 17 years
3. Subject is not pregnant, nursing, prisoner, or ward of the state
4. Subject or subject's representative signed informed consent and assent when, applicable, and is willing and able to comply with all study requirements
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Insufficient quantity or quality of bone.
2. Blood supply limitations and previous infections, which may retard healing.
3. Foreign-body sensitivity.
4. Any active infection or blood supply limitations.
5. Conditions that tend to limit the patient's ability or willingness to restrict activities or follow directions during the healing period.
